title: Drawing, "Tureen", 1800–20
medium: Brush and brown wash, pen and brown ink,  pencil, on paper
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: A vase with two handles.  The body is supported visibly by two gaines, the capitals of which are connected by festoons.  Above in central part of the body is a circular medallion with two figures, at the sides, masks.  The cover has the shape of a pedestal with what looks like owl.  Two children are lying beside.  The decoration of the upper rim of the vase is shown, sketched, below at the left of the tureen.  In lower left corner is a part of a circle.  On back is an account.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Tureen", 1800–20.
1800–20. Brush and brown wash, pen and brown ink,  pencil, on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-236.
